user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of UT_ExecuteVaHandler:
```c
void UT_ExecuteVaHandler(UT_EntryKey_t FuncKey, const char *FunctionName, UT_VaHandlerFunc_t DefaultHandler,
                         va_list VaList)
{
    /* Check if the test case registered a hook, and use the default if not */
    if (UT_GetStubEntry(FuncKey, UT_ENTRYTYPE_FINAL_HANDLER) == NULL && DefaultHandler != NULL)
    {
        UT_SetVaHandlerFunction(FuncKey, DefaultHandler, NULL);
    }

    UT_DefaultStubImplWithArgs(FunctionName, FuncKey, 0, VaList);
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
void UT_ExecuteVaHandler(UT_EntryKey_t FuncKey, const char *FunctionName, UT_VaHandlerFunc_t DefaultHandler,
                         va_list VaList)
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.8 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: UT_ExecuteVaHandler does not modify any of its parameters. All parameters are only read and passed to other functions. (A violation would occur if the function reassigned a parameter, e.g. FunctionName = NULL; DefaultHandler = some_func; or VaList = another_va_list; or incremented a pointer parameter.)
